text: Just took a VR tour of my dream house in Miami while sitting in NYC! Saved so much time and money on travel. The future of house hunting is here! ?? #VRrealestate
Amazing AR experience with @RealtyApp - could visualize different furniture layouts and wall colors in real-time during the house viewing! #PropTech
Virtual staging through VR helped me sell my house in just 2 weeks! Buyers loved seeing different design possibilities #RealEstateTech
The AR measuring tool was spot-on! No more carrying tape measures to viewings - just scanned rooms with my phone to check if furniture would fit ????
VR walkthrough helped my overseas clients make a confident purchase decision without flying in. Closed the deal entirely remotely! #InternationalRealEstate
Love how VR tours show the property in different lighting conditions - morning, afternoon, evening. Such a game-changer for buying! #RealEstate
AR renovation preview is incredible! Showed me exactly how my kitchen remodel would look before committing. No more guesswork! #PropertyTech
VR neighborhood tours are brilliant! Got to virtually walk around the area, check out local shops, and see the commute route. Sold! #RealEstate
The AR property info overlay is fantastic - point your phone at any house and instantly see price history, square footage, and recent sales! #PropTech
VR multi-property tours saved me weeks of house hunting. Viewed 15 properties in one sitting! This is revolutionary ??? #RealEstateTechnology
VR tour completely misrepresented the property size - rooms looked way bigger virtually than in reality. Wasted trip! #RealEstateProblems
AR measuring tool was off by several inches. Had to return furniture that didn't fit despite using the app. Don't trust it! #PropTechFail
Virtual staging made the property look nothing like reality. Felt completely misled when I saw it in person. #FalseAdvertising
VR tour quality was terrible - laggy, blurry, and made me dizzy. Couldn't even finish viewing the property! ?? #VRfail
AR renovation preview was so inaccurate - colors and textures looked completely different in reality. Expensive mistake! #RenovationFail
The VR neighborhood tour didn't show the construction site next door. Convenient omission! Very misleading ?? #RealEstateScam
AR property info was outdated and incorrect. Showed wrong price and square footage. Do your own research! #PropTech
VR tour crashed halfway through. Wasted an hour trying to get it working again. Stick to traditional viewings! #TechFail
The AR sunlight tracking feature was completely wrong - bought a 'sunny' apartment that's actually in shadow most of the day #Misleading
VR tour didn't show any of the property's flaws - convenient how water damage isn't visible in virtual reality! #RealEstateProblems
VR property tours are interesting but still need improvement. Good for initial screening, but in-person visits are essential. #RealEstate
AR furniture placement is helpful but not perfect. Sometimes accurate, sometimes off. Use with caution. #PropTech
Virtual staging helps visualize possibilities, but remember it's just a digital representation. Always view property in person. #RealEstate
VR tours work well for layout understanding but can't replicate the feel of a space. Good first step in house hunting. #PropertyTech
AR property info overlay is convenient but double-check the data. Not always up to date. #RealEstate #Technology
Using VR for initial property viewings. Saves time but still need in-person visits for final decisions. #RealEstateTips
AR renovation previews are useful for basic visualization but consult professionals for accurate planning. #Renovation
VR neighborhood tours give a general idea but can't replace actually walking around the area. Use as starting point. #PropertyHunting
The AR measuring tool is handy for rough estimates but bring a tape measure for important measurements. #RealEstateTech
VR property tours are becoming common in luxury real estate. Interesting trend but jury's still out on effectiveness. #PropTech
